intro: Rourea chiliantha, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen, lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for cultivation in warm, tropical climates. Rourea chiliantha is often used as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and hardy nature.
